title: Workshop on Mathematical Modeling Instructional Design for Technology-Enhanced Anatomy Education

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience, basic statistical and graph interpretation skills
context.additional_context: Technology integration training for pre-service/in-service teachers in anatomy education with project-based assessment. Emphasis on converting anatomical data into mathematical models (coordinate systems, function graphs, etc.).

learning_goals: Demonstrate competency in designing visualization and mathematical modeling lessons using technology tools (e.g., Screencast) in anatomy education.
Apply statistical analysis methods (mean, standard deviation, t-test, etc.) when designing pre- and post-tests for measuring learning effectiveness.

Within one week, learners apply the 5-stage TEL (Technology Enhanced Learning) material development process (needs analysis, design, development, evaluation, improvement) to complete a project-based assessment taskâ€”from selecting a topic on expressing anatomical structures as mathematical graphs/equations to submitting a prototype.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
